intro: Statice rumelica var. tempskyana, commonly known as the Balkan statice, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It is part of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with similar structural and ecological traits. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its drought tolerance and long-lasting blooms.
